evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The environmental or marking deficiency should align with the key features and characteristics relevant to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA within the specified historical preliminary period.

defeater_resistance.reasoning_summary: The evidence describes a controlled pushback operation with active human control and communication (H1, H2, H3), yet the aircraft moved beyond the intended stop point and hit a barrier (H4). This suggests mechanical/control failure is unlikely as the cause since human operators were actively managing the pushback, indicating the explanation is weakly supported and vulnerable to defeaters.
defeater_resistance.uncertainty_source: No direct evidence of mechanical or control failure is provided; ambiguity remains due to lack of system diagnostics or failure reports.

defeaters: Evidence indicating mechanical or control system malfunction during the event
Technical analysis confirming mechanical/control failure
fit_to_key_features.reasoning_summary: The evidence describes the sequence of events during pushback but does not mention any mechanical or control failure; thus, no alignment with mechanical/control failure is supported (H1-H4).
